data.title: Settlers 25th Anniversary Collection - Announced
data.text:
Silver

Spaceman

Joined

February 13, 2014

Messages

9,321

Location

New Zealand

August 22, 2018

#1

@Indie Retro News Settlers 25th Anniversary Collection has been announced and will feature a re-release of all Settlers games.

...

Available from November 15th 2018 through Uplay with the first game in the collection available now. This Settlers packed bonanza will include all patches and expansions, as well as updates and enhancements to allow them to play on modern PCs and Windows 10. So that's Settlers 1, Settlers 2 Gold, The Settlers III, The Settlers IV, The Settlers Heritage of Kings, The Settlers Rise of an Empire, and even The Settlers 7!

More information.

#8

Yes, that's how the box of the first game looked like.

One gaming magazine had audio tracks of the main themes of many games on their magazine's CD, and one of them had The Settler's very first theme …

Of course, no gaming magazine won't do that today. A) because of copyright issues, b) because of streaming c) because if a magazine did it, that would soon be forbidden, and the publisher would jump in and want to do that instead to ensure more profits …

Yes, that's how the box of the first game looked like.

One gaming magazine had audio tracks of the main themes of many games on their magazine's CD, and one of them had The Settler's very first theme …

Of course, no gaming magazine won't do that today. A) because of copyright issues, b) because of streaming c) because if a magazine did it, that would soon be forbidden, and the publisher would jump in and want to do that instead to ensure more profits …

Don't forget that at that time also audio was directly saved as cd tracks. One example would be Dungeon Keeper.

But I also remember that Settlers 2 had at least it's intro song as audio track on cd. One of the most amazing tracks of any intro (at least if you like that kind of evangelis style music)
